member.summary: Configures Rebus to use an outbox. This will store a (message ID, source queue) tuple for all processed messages, and under this tuple any messages sent/published will also be stored, thus enabling truly idempotent message processing.

member.name: T:Rebus.Config.SqlServerTransportConfigurationExtensions
member.summary: Configuration extensions for the SQL transport

member.name: M:Rebus.Config.SqlServerTransportConfigurationExtensions.UseSqlServerInLeaseMode(Rebus.Config.StandardConfigurer{Rebus.Transport.ITransport},Rebus.Config.SqlServerLeaseTransportOptions,System.String)
member.summary: Configures Rebus to use SQL Server as its transport. Unlike the UseSqlServer calls the leased version of the SQL Server transport does not hold a transaction open for the entire duration of the message handling. Instead it marks a message as being "leased" for a period of time. If the lease has expired then a worker is permitted to acquire the that message again and try reprocessing
member.param: Static to extend
Options controlling the transport setup
Queue name to process messages from

member.name: M:Rebus.Config.SqlServerTransportConfigurationExtensions.UseSqlServerInLeaseModeAsOneWayClient(Rebus.Config.StandardConfigurer{Rebus.Transport.ITransport},Rebus.Config.SqlServerLeaseTransportOptions)
member.summary: Configures Rebus to use SQL Server as its transport in "one-way client mode" (i.e. as a send only endpoint). Unlike the UseSqlServer calls the leased version of the SQL Server transport does not hold a transaction open for the entire duration of the message handling. Instead it marks a message as being "leased" for a period of time. If the lease has expired then a worker is permitted to acquire the that message again and try reprocessing
member.param: Static to extend
Options controlling the transport setup

member.name: M:Rebus.Config.SqlServerTransportConfigurationExtensions.UseSqlServer(Rebus.Config.StandardConfigurer{Rebus.Transport.ITransport},Rebus.Config.SqlServerTransportOptions,System.String)
member.summary: Configures Rebus to use SQL Server as its transport
member.param: Static to extend
Options controlling the transport setup
Queue name to process messages from

member.name: M:Rebus.Config.SqlServerTransportConfigurationExtensions.UseSqlServerAsOneWayClient(Rebus.Config.StandardConfigurer{Rebus.Transport.ITransport},Rebus.Config.SqlServerTransportOptions)
member.summary: Configures Rebus to use SQLServer as its transport in "one-way client mode" (i.e. as a send-only endpoint).

Configures Rebus to use SQL Server as its transport (in "one-way client mode", i.e. as a send-only endpoint). Unlike the UseSqlServer calls the leased version of the SQL Server transport does not hold a transaction open for the entire duration of the message handling. Instead it marks a message as being "leased" for a period of time. If the lease has expired then a worker is permitted to acquire the that message again and try reprocessing
member.param: Static to extend
Connection string

If null will default to . Specifies how long a worker will request to keep a message. Higher values require less database communication but increase latency of a message being processed if a worker dies
If null defaults to . Workers will wait for this amount of time to elapse, beyond the lease time, before they pick up an already leased message.
If true then workers will automatically renew the lease they have acquired whilst they're still processing the message. This will occur in accordance with

If null defaults to . Specifies how frequently a lease will be renewed whilst the worker is processing a message. Lower values decrease the chance of other workers processing the same message but increase DB communication. A value 50% of should be appropriate
If non-null a factory which returns a string identifying this worker when it leases a message. If null> the current machine name is used
If true the connection will be enlisted in the ambient transaction if it exists, else it will create an SqlTransaction and enlist in it

If true tables for the queue will be created at run time. This means the connection provided to the transport must have schema modification rights. If false tables must be created externally before running

member.summary: Configures Rebus to use SQL Server as its transport (in "one-way client mode", i.e. as a send-only endpoint). The message table will automatically be created if it does not exist.
member.param: Static to extend
Factory to provide a new connection

If null will default to . Specifies how long a worker will request to keep a message. Higher values require less database communication but increase latency of a message being processed if a worker dies
If null defaults to . Workers will wait for this amount of time to elapse, beyond the lease time, before they pick up an already leased message.
If true then workers will automatically renew the lease they have acquired whilst they're still processing the message. This will occur in accordance with

If null defaults to . Specifies how frequently a lease will be renewed whilst the worker is processing a message. Lower values decrease the chance of other workers processing the same message but increase DB communication. A value 50% of should be appropriate
If non-null a factory which returns a string identifying this worker when it leases a message. If null> the current machine name is used

member.summary: Configures Rebus to use SQL Server as its transport. Unlike the UseSqlServer calls the leased version of the SQL Server transport does not hold a transaction open for the entire duration of the message handling. Instead it marks a message as being "leased" for a period of time. If the lease has expired then a worker is permitted to acquire the that message again and try reprocessing
member.param: Static to extend
Connection string
Name of the queue, which must be a valid table table in SQL Server

If null will default to . Specifies how long a worker will request to keep a message. Higher values require less database communication but increase latency of a message being processed if a worker dies
If null defaults to . Workers will wait for this amount of time to elapse, beyond the lease time, before they pick up an already leased message.
If true then workers will automatically renew the lease they have acquired whilst they're still processing the message. This will occur in accordance with

If null defaults to . Specifies how frequently a lease will be renewed whilst the worker is processing a message. Lower values decrease the chance of other workers processing the same message but increase DB communication. A value 50% of should be appropriate
If non-null a factory which returns a string identifying this worker when it leases a message. If null> the current machine name is used
If true the connection will be enlisted in the ambient transaction if it exists, else it will create an SqlTransaction and enlist in it

If true tables for the queue will be created at run time. This means the connection provided to the transport must have schema modification rights. If false tables must be created externally before running

member.summary: Configures Rebus to use SQL Server as its transport. The "queue" specified by will be used when querying for messages. The message table will automatically be created if it does not exist.
member.param: Static to extend
Factory to provide a new connection
Name of the queue, which must be a valid table table in SQL Server

If null will default to . Specifies how long a worker will request to keep a message. Higher values require less database communication but increase latency of a message being processed if a worker dies
If null defaults to . Workers will wait for this amount of time to elapse, beyond the lease time, before they pick up an already leased message.
If true then workers will automatically renew the lease they have acquired whilst they're still processing the message. This will occur in accordance with

If null defaults to . Specifies how frequently a lease will be renewed whilst the worker is processing a message. Lower values decrease the chance of other workers processing the same message but increase DB communication. A value 50% of should be appropriate
If non-null a factory which returns a string identifying this worker when it leases a message. If null> the current machine name is used

If true tables for the queue will be created at run time. This means the connection provided to the transport must have schema modification rights. If false tables must be created externally before running

member.summary: Marks that all work has been successfully done and the may have its transaction committed or whatever is natural to do at this time

member.name: M:Rebus.SqlServer.DbConnectionWrapper.Dispose
member.summary: Finishes the transaction and disposes the connection in order to return it to the connection pool. If the transaction has not been committed (by calling ), the transaction will be rolled back.

member.name: T:Rebus.SqlServer.Transport.SqlServerLeaseTransport
member.summary: Similar to but does not maintain an active connection during message processing. Instead a "lease" is acquired for each message and only once "committed" is the message removed from the queue. Note: This also changes the semantics of sending. Sent messages are queued in memory and are not committed to memory until the sender has committed

member.name: F:Rebus.SqlServer.Transport.SqlServerLeaseTransport.OutboundMessageBufferKey
member.summary: Key for storing the outbound message buffer when performing

member.summary: Size of the leasedby column

member.summary: If not specified the default time messages are leased for

member.name: F:Rebus.SqlServer.Transport.SqlServerLeaseTransport.DefaultLeaseTolerance
member.summary: If not specified the amount of tolerance workers will allow a message which has already been leased

member.name: F:Rebus.SqlServer.Transport.SqlServerLeaseTransport.DefaultLeaseAutomaticRenewal
member.summary: If not specified the amount of time the workers will automatically renew leases for actively handled messages
Constructor
member.param: A to obtain a database connection
Name of the queue this transport is servicing
A for building loggers
A for creating periodic tasks
A to provide the current time
Interval of time messages are leased for
Buffer to allow lease overruns by
Factory for generating a string which identifies who has leased a message (eg. A hostname)
Additional options
